SENT.plain: This study was conducted to assess the frequency of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and Barrett's esophagus among Sudanese patients with clinical symptoms of heartburn

One hundred and five patients were included in the study; forty seven patients had evidence of reflux oesophagitis, 61.7% of whom had grade B oesophagitis according to the modified Los Angeles classification and 10.6% had Barrett's oesophagus
78.7% of the biopsies from the esophageal cardia revealed presenced of inflammation (Carditis)
Dysplasia was documented in 21.3% of these biopsies
Helicobacter pylori was detected 59.6% of gastrooesophageal reflux disease patients and 56.8% of patients with carditis
However, 80% of patients with Barrett oesophagus were positive for Helicobacter pylori

It was concluded that gastro-oesophageal reflux disease affects all age groups with males being affected more than females and Helicobacter pylori infection did not play a major role in gastro-oesophageal reflux disease orits complications
